info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 12 at 11:31AM CDT until July 12 at 1:30PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Callahan.
* WHEN...Until 130 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1128 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow moving showers and thunderstorms across central and southern Callahan County. This will cause small stream flooding. - Rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This will result in minor flooding of creeks, streams, and low water crossings across central and southern Callahan County. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clyde, Baird, Cross Plains, Putnam, Rowden, Atwell, Eula, Dudley, Admiral, Us-283 Near The Coleman-Callahan County Line and I-20 Near The Callahan-Eastland County Line. - This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 298 and 323.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON
